question: In outdoor field hockey, a free hit is awarded to the attack within the 23-meter area. What are the restrictions on playing the ball into the circle, and what are the exceptions?
ground_truth: From a free hit awarded to the attack within the 23-meter area, the ball must not be played into the circle until it has travelled at least 5 metres, not necessarily in a single direction, or has been touched by a player of the defending team. question: In hockey5s, according to the rules, what constitutes dangerous play, and where is the penalty awarded?
ground_truth: Dangerous play involves playing the ball dangerously or in a way that leads to dangerous play. A ball can be dangerous in itself or when it causes legitimate evasive action by players. The penalty is awarded where the action causing the danger took place.
source_text:
9.7 Players must not play the ball dangerously or in a way which leads to
dangerous play.
A ball may be dangerous in itself; it is also considered dangerous
when it causes legitimate evasive action by players. The penalty is
awarded where the action causing the danger took place.

question: What happens if a team has more than the permitted number of players on the field?
ground_truth: If a team has more than the permitted number of players on the field, time should be stopped to correct the situation. A personal penalty may be awarded against the captain of the team involved, if inadvertently having too many players on the pitch occurs for a very short period of time and does not materially affect the match. In cases where this occurs and materially affects the match, a personal penalty must be awarded against the captain of the team involved.
